duties_responsibilities.duty: Assist in carrying out research studies in a team setting.
Administer computerized brain training exercises to older adults.
Maintain communication to monitor participant progress in their training exercises.
Obtain informed consent and administer neuropsychiatric assessments.
Collect, analyze, and enter data for clinical trials and ensure quality control.
Establish rapport with study participants and maintain contact with participants enrolled in the study.
Facilitate, support, and motivate older adult study participants during their study participation.
Communicate by email and phone with study participants to ensure adherence to intervention.
Participate in the mandatory lab meetings and implement study participant recruiting and screening protocols.
Meet recruitment and enrollment goals and determine if older adult participants meet study eligibility requirements.
Devote at least 5 hours weekly to telephone recruitment and interviewing.
Complete data forms with high accuracy and attention to detail.
Travel to and attend community events to assist with recruitment and facilitate meeting enrollment goals.
Disseminate information on studies to study participants and the general public.
Train any assistants and volunteers who gather and enter data.
Monitor compliance of study procedures with regulations and perform data quality control procedures.
Work with minimal supervision, plan, organize, and coordinate multiple work assignments and establish and maintain effective working relationships with others.
Effectively and professionally communicate sensitive information and maintain confidentiality.

education_certification.credential: B.S or B.A. degree in biological or clinical sciences preferred.
